title: Drug-Eluting Stent Implantation Versus Optimal Medical Treatment in Patients

operands.value: Patients with angina or silent ischemia and documented ischemia
Patients who are eligible for intracoronary stenting
Age > 18 years
De novo lesion CTO
Reference vessel size 2.5 mm by visual estimation
At least one CTO lesion located in proximal or mid epicardial coronary artery
Two CTO lesions
One CTO lesion located in proximal or mid epicardial coronary artery
Angiographically defined total occlusion over 3 months
definite symptom with total occlusion
two experienced operators decide CTO in consideration of angiographical morphology (degree of calcification, bridging collaterals, non-tapered stump, angiographic filling from collaterals)
Must have minimum age of 18 Years
History of bleeding diathesis or coagulopathy
Pregnant state
Three vessel CTO
Known hypersensitivity or contra-indication to contrast agent and heparin
ST-elevation acute myocardial infarction requiring primary stenting
Left main disease
In-stent restenosis
Graft vessels
Distal epicardial coronary artery CTO lesions
Hematological disease
Hepatic dysfunction, liver enzyme (ALT and AST) elevation 3 times normal
Renal dysfunction, creatinine more than 2.0
Contraindication to aspirin, clopidogrel or other commercial antiplatelet agent
Left ventricular ejection fraction
Patients who are actively participating in another drug or device investigational study, which have not completed the primary endpoint follow-up period
Non-cardiac co-morbid conditions are present with limited life expectancy or that may result in protocol non-compliance (per site investigator's medical judgment)

symPyExpression: And(Symbol('Age > 18 years'), Symbol('Angiographically defined total occlusion over 3 months'), Symbol('De novo lesion CTO'), Symbol('Must have minimum age of 18 Years'), Symbol('Patients who are eligible for intracoronary stenting'), Symbol('Patients with angina or silent ischemia and documented ischemia'), Symbol('Reference vessel size 2.5 mm by visual estimation'), Implies(Not(Symbol('definite symptom with total occlusion')), Symbol('two experienced operators decide CTO in consideration of angiographical morphology (degree of calcification, bridging collaterals, non-tapered stump, angiographic filling from collaterals)')), Or(Symbol('At least one CTO lesion located in proximal or mid epicardial coronary artery'), And(Symbol('One CTO lesion located in proximal or mid epicardial coronary artery'), Symbol('Two CTO lesions'))), Not(Or(Symbol('Contraindication to aspirin, clopidogrel or other commercial antiplatelet agent'), Symbol('Distal epicardial coronary artery CTO lesions'), Symbol('Graft vessels'), Symbol('Hematological disease'), Symbol('Hepatic dysfunction, liver enzyme (ALT and AST) elevation 3 times normal'), Symbol('History of bleeding diathesis or coagulopathy'), Symbol('In-stent restenosis'), Symbol('Known hypersensitivity or contra-indication to contrast agent and heparin'), Symbol('Left main disease'), Symbol('Left ventricular ejection fraction'), Symbol("Non-cardiac co-morbid conditions are present with limited life expectancy or that may result in protocol non-compliance (per site investigator's medical judgment)"), Symbol('Patients who are actively participating in another drug or device investigational study, which have not completed the primary endpoint follow-up period'), Symbol('Pregnant state'), Symbol('Renal dysfunction, creatinine more than 2.0'), Symbol('ST-elevation acute myocardial infarction requiring primary stenting'), Symbol('Three vessel CTO'))))
